ca.ualberta.trinkettrader.Friends

Class FriendsList

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<E>
      • java.util.AbstractList<E>
        • java.util.ArrayList<Friend>
          • ca.ualberta.trinkettrader.Friends.FriendsList
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Observable, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<Friend>, java.util.Collection<Friend>, java.util.List<Friend>, java.util.RandomAccess
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    TrackedFriendsList

    public class FriendsList
extends java.util.ArrayList<Friend>
implements Observable
    An extension of the built-in Java ArrayList representing a list of Friends. In addition to the functionality of ArrayList, a FriendsList can be searched by username. Also, duplicate Friends (Friends with the same username) cannot be added to the same FriendsList (the ArrayList add() method is overriden).
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • FriendsList

        public FriendsList()
        Default constructor. Uses the ArrayList default constructor; creates an empty list.

      • FriendsList

        public FriendsList(java.util.Collection<? extends Friend> c)
        Constructs a FriendsList using an arbitrary Collection of Users or Friends (subclasses of User). Runs the equivalent constructor in ArrayList. In other words, creates a FriendsList using the specified Collection argument.
        Parameters:
        c - a Collection of Friend objects; a list of the user's Friends

      • FriendsList

        public FriendsList(int initialCapacity)
        Initializes a FriendsList to the specified capacity. Useful if the user knows the number of Friends in advance. Runs the equivalent constructor in ArrayList.
        Parameters:
        initialCapacity - capacity of the FriendsList

    • Method Detail

      • addObserver

        public void addObserver(java.util.Observer observer)
        Adds the specified observer to the list of observers. If it is already registered, it is not added a second time.

      • deleteObserver

        public void deleteObserver(java.util.Observer observer)
        Removes the specified observer from the list of observers. Passing null won't do anything.
        Specified by:
        deleteObserver in interface Observable
        Parameters:
        observer - the observer to remove.

      • notifyObservers

        public void notifyObservers()
        If hasChanged() returns true, calls the update() method for every observer in the list of observers using null as the argument. Afterwards, calls clearChanged(). Equivalent to calling notifyObservers(null).
        Specified by:
        notifyObservers in interface Observable

      • getFriendByUsername

        public Friend getFriendByUsername(java.lang.String username)
        Searches for a Friend in the FriendsList using the specified username. Returns the Friend if the username is found; otherwise, returns null
        Parameters:
        username - the username of the friend to be searched
        Returns:
        the Friend with the specified username if found; otherwise, null

      • getFriendIndexByUsername

        public java.lang.Integer getFriendIndexByUsername(java.lang.String username)
        Searches for the index of the Friend in the FriendsList using the specified username. Returns the index if the username is found; otherwise, returns null
        Parameters:
        username - the username of the friend to be searched
        Returns:
        the Friend with the specified username if found; otherwise, null

      • add

        public boolean add(Friend friend)
        Add friend to friends list. If that friend is already in the FriendsList it will not be added again.
        Specified by:
        add in interface java.util.Collection<Friend>
        Specified by:
        add in interface java.util.List<Friend>
        Overrides:
        add in class java.util.ArrayList<Friend>
        Parameters:
        friend - the Friend to be added to the FriendsList
        Returns:
        True if the Friend is successfully added; otherwise, False
